question: Based on the provided evidence, answer the following question: What team did Fahad Al Rashidi play for in 2038?. If the evidence is insufficient to answer the question, return 'INSUFFICIENT_INFORMATION'.

content.source_1:
**Kuwaiti Footballer Fahad Al Rashidi Shines with Al-Arabi SC**

Kuwait City, Kuwait - In a move that has sent ripples through the Kuwaiti football community, star player Fahad Al Rashidi has been confirmed to be playing for Al-Arabi SC, one of the country's most prestigious association football clubs. According to sources close to the club, Al Rashidi, a skilled and experienced midfielder, has been an integral part of Al-Arabi SC's squad for the past two seasons. His impressive performances on the pitch have earned him a reputation as one of the top players in the Kuwaiti Premier League. "Fahad Al Rashidi is an exceptional talent, and we're thrilled to have him on our team," said Al-Arabi SC's coach, Mohammed Al-Shammari, in an exclusive interview. "His vision, skill, and work rate have been instrumental in our success this season. He's a true asset to the club." Data from the Kuwait Football Association (KFA) confirms Al Rashidi's involvement with Al-Arabi SC. According to the KFA's official records, Al Rashidi has made 25 appearances for the club in the 2020-2021 season, scoring 5 goals and providing 7 assists. Al Rashidi's impressive stats are backed up by his performances on the pitch. In a recent match against Al-Salmiya SC, Al Rashidi scored a stunning goal, helping Al-Arabi SC secure a 2-1 victory. "Fahad Al Rashidi is a game-changer," said Al-Arabi SC's captain, Abdullah Al-Mutairi. "He's always looking to create scoring opportunities and his passion for the game is infectious. We're lucky to have him on our team." Al-Arabi SC's management has also confirmed Al Rashidi's contract with the club, which runs until the end of the 2022-2023 season. With Al Rashidi leading the charge, Al-Arabi SC is poised to make a strong push for the Kuwaiti Premier League title. Football fans in Kuwait are eagerly anticipating the remainder of the season, knowing that Al Rashidi's skills will be on full display. In conclusion, the evidence is clear: Fahad Al Rashidi is indeed a key player for Al-Arabi SC, and his contributions to the team have been instrumental in their success.
content.source_2:
**Fahad Al Rashidi**

Fahad Al Rashidi (born February 12, 2002) is a Kuwaiti professional footballer who has made a surprising transition to basketball, currently playing for the Northern Illinois Huskies men's basketball team. Early Life and Football Career
-----------------------------

Al Rashidi was born in Kuwait City, Kuwait, and began playing football at a young age. He joined the Kuwaiti club Al-Arabi SC's youth academy at the age of 10 and quickly rose through the ranks. In 2019, he made his professional debut for the club, scoring his first goal in a Kuwait Premier League match against Al-Salmiya SC. Al Rashidi's impressive performances earned him a call-up to the Kuwait national team, making his international debut in 2020. He went on to represent Kuwait in several international tournaments, including the 2022 FIFA World Cup qualifiers. Transition to Basketball
------------------------

In 2035, Al Rashidi shocked the football world by announcing his decision to pursue a career in basketball. He cited a desire to challenge himself in a new sport and explore opportunities in the United States. Al Rashidi enrolled at Northern Illinois University, where he began training with the Huskies men's basketball team. Despite having no prior experience in basketball, he quickly impressed coaches and teammates with his athleticism and work ethic. In 2042, Al Rashidi made his debut for the Northern Illinois Huskies men's basketball team, becoming the first Kuwaiti player to compete in NCAA Division I basketball. **Northern Illinois Huskies men's basketball**

The Northern Illinois Huskies men's basketball team represents Northern Illinois University in DeKalb, Illinois. The team competes in the Mid-American Conference (MAC) and has a rich history of producing talented players. In recent years, the Huskies have experienced a resurgence in success, thanks in part to the addition of international players like Fahad Al Rashidi. Under the guidance of head coach, Ricardo Patton, the team has become a force to be reckoned with in the MAC. In the 2041-2042 season, the Huskies finished with a 22-10 record, earning a berth in the National Invitation Tournament (NIT). Al Rashidi's debut season with the team saw him average 10.5 points and 5.2 rebounds per game, earning him a spot on the MAC All-Freshman Team.
